intro: Ranunculus auricomus subsp. minutulus, commonly known as the dwarf buttercup, is a member of the Ranunculaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 10–20 centimeters. The plant features small, bright yellow flowers with five petals, often surrounded by a ring of sepals that resemble leaves. Its leaves are deeply lobed and have a distinctive, somewhat fern-like appearance. Native to the mountainous regions of central and southern Europe, it thrives in moist, well-drained soils and partial shade.
